subject: Display host chosen for instance by scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-27 13:20:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d5d882d85235a7aaa419042571aa82434d66bf22', 'message': "Display host chosen for instance by scheduler

The scheduler is configured to schedule an instance on a host chosen
randomly from a subset of the N best hosts. Where the size of the subset
is defined as 'scheduler_host_subset_size' from the configuration.

In a configuration where the subset is greater than the default (1) the
scheduler does not display where it has scheduled the instance to. It
gives a list of all those that it has weighed - just not the one chosen.

This patch displays the chosen host.

Closes-Bug: 1426364

Change-Id: Ibd7d6dcd67609217d5be5e50fbad130676f403d4
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-27 14:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f1b45a2a404f5e38d0a2535f76dda0fa99767d77', 'message': "Display host chosen for instance by scheduler

The scheduler is configured to schedule an instance on a host chosen
randomly from a subset of the N best hosts. Where the size of the subset
is defined as 'scheduler_host_subset_size' from the configuration.

In a configuration where the subset is greater than the default (1) the
scheduler does not display where it has scheduled the instance to. It
gives a list of all those that it has weighed - just not the one chosen.

This patch displays the chosen host.

Closes-Bug: 1426364

Change-Id: Ibd7d6dcd67609217d5be5e50fbad130676f403d4

commit_message:
Display host chosen for instance by scheduler

The scheduler is configured to schedule an instance on a host chosen
randomly from a subset of the N best hosts. Where the size of the subset
is defined as 'scheduler_host_subset_size' from the configuration.

In a configuration where the subset is greater than the default (1) the
scheduler does not display where it has scheduled the instance to. It
gives a list of all those that it has weighed - just not the one chosen.

This patch displays the chosen host.

Closes-Bug: 1426364

Change-Id: Ibd7d6dcd67609217d5be5e50fbad130676f403d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/159828/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("Chosen %(host)s", {'host': chosen_host})

commit_message:
db: Add index on fixed_ips updated_at

Adding sqlalchemy code to add an index to the fixed_ips table on
the deleted, allocated and updated_at columns, to speed up the
periodic disassociate_all_by_timeout task

Closes-Bug: #1363119
Change-Id: Iee53b5fd31b56bf1e0dddeada42ee9267b156150
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/122240/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_255(self, engine, data): self.assertIndexMembers(engine, 'fixed_ips', 'fixed_ips_deleted_allocated_updated_at_idx', ['deleted', 'allocated', 'updated_at']) def _post_downgrade_255(self, engine): fixed_ips = oslodbutils.get_table(engine, 'fixed_ips') index_names = [idx.name for idx in fixed_ips.indexes] self.assertNotIn('fixed_ips_deleted_allocated_updated_at_idx', index_names)

commit_message:
Converted the agent config file to yaml to match the plugin config files

Converted the config file to yaml and updated the config processing logic to match.
Cleaned up some deprecated config item processing.

Change-Id: I8c5d9ad841b22d20825608ac9f2c82d8011b04f0

commit_message:
Accomodate pypowervm restructures

Refactor to accomodate 'tersify' pypowervm change sets:

WrapperClass(entry_or_element) => WrapperClass.wrap(entry_or_element)
WrapperClass.load_from_response(resp) => WrapperClass.wrap(resp)
Various crt_* methods are gone, replaced by WrapperClass.bld(...).
Various wrapper classes are renamed.
Various constants are gone.
Accessing *._entry and *._element is no longer required or allowed.

Change-Id: I0a694553046e269ffc6f637ed0f38374bed2e064
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/77/160477/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from pypowervm.wrappers import constants as pvm_consts # We know that the mappings are VirtualSCSIMappings. Remove the # storage that resides in the scsi map from the volume group self.adapter.update(vg_wrap._element, vg_wrap.etag, pvm_vios.VIO_ROOT, self.vios_uuid, child_type=pvm_st.VG_ROOT, vios_resp = self.adapter.read(pvm_vios.VIO_ROOT, self.vios_uuid, xag=[pvm_vios.XAG_VIOS_SCSI_MAPPING]) vios_w = pvm_vios.VirtualIOServer.load_from_response(vios_resp) vios_w, pvm_st.VirtualDisk) self.adapter.update(vios_w._element, vios_w.etag, pvm_vios.VIO_ROOT, vios_w.uuid, xag=[pvm_vios.XAG_VIOS_SCSI_MAPPING]) self.adapter.update(vg_wrap._element, vg_wrap.etag, pvm_consts.VIOS, root_id=self.vios_uuid, child_type=pvm_consts.VOL_GROUP, child_id=self.vg_uuid, xag=None) resp = adapter.read(pvm_consts.VIOS, root_id=vios_uuid, child_type=pvm_consts.VOL_GROUP) vol_grps = pvm_st.VolumeGroup.load_from_response(resp) vg_rsp = self.adapter.read(pvm_vios.VIO_ROOT, root_id=self.vios_uuid, child_type=pvm_st.VG_ROOT, child_id=self.vg_uuid) return pvm_st.VolumeGroup.load_from_response(self._get_vg())

commit_message:
Add _LW for missing translations

nova has following log method
err_str = _LW("xxxxx")
LOG.warn(err_str % exc)
so if _LW is not added, current hacking will not find
it. However , if we change the re from current to
r"(.)*LOG\.(warn)\(.*")
it will be generic. So this patch only fix existing
occurances and leave the hacking alone.

The pep8 check only checks format LOG.warning but
it didn't check logger.warning, and nova need to translate
the warning messages.

8510d3aaeeb18bdbe333d2d5d4c335f3732c4848 removed N331
checking so we don't need to consider warn or warning

Closes-Bug: #1412727

Change-Id: I8834e3b397b947cb47307f1fe0f96ef4fe22b173
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/145506/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.warning(err_str % exc, instance=instance)

commit_message:
Use debtcollector library to replace internal utility

The new debtcollector library was extracted from this
code and has now been released (and made available in
the requirements list) so we can go ahead and just use
it for most of the cases (minus the proxy moved class)
in our code-base to reduce the amount of custom code
we have to maintain to perform deprecation activities.

Change-Id: Ieeda6ffe282b67a1c1bb4f72e5858d22df0f30a0

Accomodate pypowervm restructures

Refactor to accomodate 'tersify' pypowervm change sets:

WrapperClass.load_from_response(resp) => WrapperClass.wrap(resp)
Various wrapper classes are renamed.
Various constants are gone.

Add flash cache policy to 3PAR config manual

Update the 3PAR config manual to reference the new
extra spec key hp3par:flash_cache.

Closes-Bug: 1427340

commit_message:
Proxy implementation

Implementing --proxy option to overwrite system HTTP_PROXY
and HTTPS_PROXY variables that python-swift library uses.

Change-Id: I4813540c7f71d1a4fe33a791cec21eedd9439203
BLUEPRINT: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/freezer/+spec/proxy-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/21/159221/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: arg_parser.add_argument( '--proxy', action='store', help=('Enforce proxy that alters system HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY'), dest='proxy', default='') # If we have provided --proxy then overwrite the system HTTP_PROXY and # HTTPS_PROXY if backup_args.__dict__['proxy']: os.environ['HTTP_PROXY'] = str(backup_args.__dict__['proxy']) os.environ['HTTPS_PROXY'] = str(backup_args.__dict__['proxy'])

commit_message:
TOSCA: consider nodejs as web server only

Per the latest TOSCA TC discussion, nodejs should be considered as a web
server only for the monitoring use case. This requires to remove connection
requirement of nodejs.

Change-Id: I192ed0ca02a9fed1dcfdeb1a78536bc136fd39e6

TOSCA: remove misleading key Entry-Definitions

The optional Entry-Definitions in the sample CSAR file is not being used. We
should create a new sample file with a meaningful Entry-Definitions.

commit_message:
Add note on running single tests to HACKING.rst

I haven't done this in a while, and I went through a number of false
starts forgetting the "--", trying to specify "filename:TestClass"
etc. before I got it to work.  Hopefully this saves someone else some
time.

Change-Id: I94590009157cce8d42002089304c66c164bcd6ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/132195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To run a single or restricted set of tests, pass a regex that matches the class name containing the tests as an extra ``tox`` argument; e.g. ``tox -- TestWSGIServer`` (note the double-hypen) will test all WSGI server tests from ``nova/tests/test_wsgi.py``; ``-- TestWSGIServer.test_uri_length_limit`` would run just that test, and ``-- TestWSGIServer|TestWSGIServerWithSSL`` would run tests from both classes.

commit_message:
Xenapi: Attempt clean shutdown when deleting instance

A guest should be given the chance to shut down cleanly even when being
deleted in case there is a volume attached.  The volume might be re-used
later so we should minimize the risk of filesystem corruption.

Change-Id: I449fa7f2ab0ef34d0d0d4e2bd648c628737faaa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/89/147289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.context = context.RequestContext('user', 'project') self.instance = fake_instance.fake_instance_obj(self.context) @mock.patch.object(vm_utils, 'destroy_vm') @mock.patch.object(vm_utils, 'clean_shutdown_vm') @mock.patch.object(vm_utils, 'hard_shutdown_vm') def test_clean_shutdown_on_destroy(self, hard_shutdown_vm, clean_shutdown_vm, destroy_vm): vm_ref = 'vm_ref' self._vmops._destroy(self.instance, vm_ref, destroy_disks=False) clean_shutdown_vm.assert_called_once_with(self._vmops._session, self.instance, vm_ref) self.assertEqual(0, hard_shutdown_vm.call_count) @mock.patch.object(vm_utils, 'destroy_vm') @mock.patch.object(vm_utils, 'clean_shutdown_vm', return_value=False) @mock.patch.object(vm_utils, 'hard_shutdown_vm') def test_clean_shutdown_failed_on_destroy(self, hard_shutdown_vm, clean_shutdown_vm, destroy_vm): vm_ref = 'vm_ref' self._vmops._destroy(self.instance, vm_ref, destroy_disks=False) clean_shutdown_vm.assert_called_once_with(self._vmops._session, self.instance, vm_ref) hard_shutdown_vm.assert_called_once_with(self._vmops._session, self.instance, vm_ref)

subject: Provide routes for neighbor IPv4 subnets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-30 13:03:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a398c2f77d2de6e546e5e08f744de3f1f7c663d9', 'message': "Provide routes for neighbor IPv4 subnets

As RFC3442 says:

   In some cases more than one IP subnet may be configured on a link.
   In such cases, a host whose IP address is in one IP subnet in the
   link could communicate directly with a host whose IP address is in a
   different IP subnet on the same link. In cases where a client is
   being assigned an IP address on an IP subnet on such a link, for each
   IP subnet in the link other than the IP subnet on which the client
   has been assigned the DHCP server MAY be configured to specify a
   router IP address of 0.0.0.0.

When network contains more that one IPv4 subnets, routes to these
subnets should also be reported in 'classless-static-routes' DHCP
option.

Change-Id: Ifcf1d99e0f0136bf52b8d13675b7ccfd48005fab
Closes-Bug: #1372885

commit_message:
Provide routes for neighbor IPv4 subnets

Network may contain several Subnets.  In this case all these subnets are
accessible via same link and two VMs with addresses from different
Subnets may talk to each other directly, bypassing default router.  For
this to work, "neighbour Subnets" should have entry in VM's routing
tables.  RFC3442 describes this situation:

   In some cases more than one IP subnet may be configured on a link.
   In such cases, a host whose IP address is in one IP subnet in the
   link could communicate directly with a host whose IP address is in a
   different IP subnet on the same link. In cases where a client is
   being assigned an IP address on an IP subnet on such a link, for each
   IP subnet in the link other than the IP subnet on which the client
   has been assigned the DHCP server MAY be configured to specify a
   router IP address of 0.0.0.0.

When network contains more that one IPv4 subnets, report these subnets
in 'classless-static-routes' DHCP option.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ifcf1d99e0f0136bf52b8d13675b7ccfd48005fab
Closes-Bug: #1372885

was reminded that we have to manually ensure they all take the same
parameters. Ideally we should just have them all inherit from one base,
and then when we load them, ensure they're all subclasses of that base.

This doesn't add any new tests because 1) it would require a ton of

commit_message:
Add base for Proxy classes to inherit from

While exploring adding a parameter that each Proxy class would need, I
was reminded that we have to manually ensure they all take the same
parameters. Ideally we should just have them all inherit from one base,
and then when we load them, ensure they're all subclasses of that base.

This doesn't add any new tests because 1) it would require a ton of
mocking to the other things which are implicitly in the way (since this
is called from _open, which is called during __init__), and  that
doesn't seem worth it because 2) it's already in a code path that gets
tested by many other Connection related tests.

Change-Id: I953bd78f05e8d72a53d262b16c349d5d69da2fbf

subject: Move common test helpers to neutron.test.common
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-13 06:15:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/55dcd61669c9ecd5d026a54d27cf4ab60641fbe9', 'message': "Move common test helpers to neutron.test.common

With the growth of Neutron's test infrastructure and the future addition
of the full-stack testing framework, some helper functions which are
shared between the various mechanisms should be moved to the
recently-created neutron.tests.common library. More and more helpers
will be added over time by similar patches, but for now we're moving:

* get_rand_name - used to generate a random name (for interfaces,
  bridges...)
* wait_until_true - used in cases we need to wait for some trigger to
  occur (for example, the full-stack framework should be able to wait
  until all the processes of the test are up).

Change-Id: I77bbc3796fe2151a4c5bc71e2d75dce613bdb792
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-19 11:39:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2ba05c55efc5add9b7331649f633ea5b1eeed933', 'message': "Move common test helpers to neutron.test.common

With the growth of Neutron's test infrastructure and the future addition
of the full-stack testing framework, some helper functions which are
shared between the various mechanisms should be moved to the
recently-created neutron.tests.common library. More and more helpers
will be added over time by similar patches, but for now we're moving:

* get_rand_name - used to generate a random name (for interfaces,
  bridges...)
* wait_until_true - used in cases we need to wait for some trigger to
  occur (for example, the full-stack framework should be able to wait
  until all the processes of the test are up).
* Pinger - used for checking for connectivity between 2 endpoints. This
  will be useful in the future (simulating a fake machine can help
  checking inner-tenant connectivity, etc).

Change-Id: I77bbc3796fe2151a4c5bc71e2d75dce613bdb792

  occur (for example, the full-stack framework should be able to wait

* Pinger - used for checking for connectivity between 2 endpoints. This
  will be useful in the future (simulating a fake machine can help

This patch also sets the ground work for a future move of
sub_base.get_rand_name. This includes removing an unneeded redirection
to it from a different module and adding TODOs for future work on it.

commit_message:
Move common test helpers to neutron.test.common

With the growth of Neutron's test infrastructure and the future addition
of the full-stack testing framework, some helper functions which are
shared between the various mechanisms should be moved to the
recently-created neutron.tests.common library. More and more helpers
will be added over time by similar patches, but for now we're moving:

* wait_until_true - used in cases we need to wait for some trigger to
  occur (for example, the full-stack framework should be able to wait
  until all the processes of the test are up).
* Pinger - used for checking for connectivity between 2 endpoints. This
  will be useful in the future (simulating a fake machine can help
  checking inner-tenant connectivity, etc).

This patch also sets the ground work for a future move of
sub_base.get_rand_name. This includes removing an unneeded redirection
to it from a different module and adding TODOs for future work on it.

Change-Id: I77bbc3796fe2151a4c5bc71e2d75dce613bdb792

commit_message:
Do not call Zabbix in case of deletion of cluster

No reason to call Zabbix to report about changes because
we delete node with it few seconds after.

Also fixed:

zabbix error respond may not contain data field

Example:

{ 'jsonrpc': '2.0', 'id': '1', 'error': {
  'message': "Error connecting to database [Can't connect
              to local MySQL server through socket
              '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)]",
  'code': 1}}

Change-Id: Ia25c7107b3dc535b6e14db74a82d096fd6caa4d0
Closes-Bug: #1419775

commit_message:
Return the full name used in calls

Resolve the full name used by call nodes for the
callee. This name will be whatever is in the code with
import aliases resolved. Note that this will not tell you
what the name refers to.

Change-Id: I73ca0ea8bf141444a48b8ad917d1a31177dc6c3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/46/160546/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_attr_qual_name(node, aliases): '''Get a the full name for the attribute node. This will resolve a pseudo-qualified name for the attribute rooted at node as long as all the deeper nodes are Names or Attributes. This will give you how the code referenced the name but will not tell you what the name actually refers to. If we encounter a node without a static name we punt with an empty string. If this encounters something more comples, such as foo.mylist[0](a,b) we just return empty string. :param node: AST Name or Attribute node :param aliases: Import aliases dictionary :returns: Qualified name refered to by the attribute or name. ''' if type(node) == _ast.Name: if node.id in aliases: return aliases[node.id] return node.id elif type(node) == _ast.Attribute: name = '%s.%s' % (_get_attr_qual_name(node.value, aliases), node.attr) if name in aliases: return aliases[name] return name else: return "" return _get_attr_qual_name(node.func, aliases)
deleted_lines: prefix = "" if type(node.func.value) == _ast.Name: if deepgetattr(node, 'func.value.id') in aliases: prefix = aliases[deepgetattr(node, 'func.value.id')] + "." else: prefix = deepgetattr(node, 'func.value.id') + "." return("%s%s" % (prefix, deepgetattr(node, 'func.attr')))

commit_message:
Fix a incorrect parameters for "Create/Update port"

Fix following parameters.
[Create Port]
  "status"
    remove from the table.

[Update Port]
  "status", "tenant_id", "mac_address", "network_id"
    remove from the table.

Change-Id: I13689b44e0e34b98e0a8499db1d9fee43af62e36
Closes-Bug: #1424927

added_lines: A symbolic name for the port. The administrative status of the port, which is up (true) or down (false). If you specify only a subnet ID, OpenStack Networking allocates an available IP from that subnet to the port. If you specify both a subnet ID and an IP address, OpenStack Networking tries to allocate the specified address to the port. Security groups. Specify one or more security group IDs. '>

commit_message:
Separate ironic-common to standalone class

The nova::compute::ironic class sets ironic on nova compute but
without ironic-client and ironic-common package nova compute won't
be able to start.

commit_message:
Adds migration script for Hyper-V Plugin tables

HyperVNeutronPlugin will be deprecated, so the tables it uses
('hyperv_vlan_allocations' and 'hyperv_network_bindings') will
have to be migrated the Ml2 equivalent tables.

Adds migration script in migrate_to_ml2.py to allow users to
migrate their table entries to the Ml2 tables.

Change-Id: If3bd2f6a43d1b9a753f9453f3f7c9c190602531e

commit_message:
Fuel plugin builder generates rpm package instead of fp archives

Fuel plugin builder for plugins with package version 2.0.0
should generate rpm packages instead of .fp archives,
nothing is changed for old plugins with version 1.0.0.

* versioning of builders
* added new fields to metadata, which are mandatory
  for rpm packages

Implements: blueprint plugins-security-fixes-delivery
Change-Id: Ic511a9565cbb75a6f4bf5525489898efcc086c90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins refs/changes/23/159523/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from distutils.version import StrictVersion def version_split_name_rpm(version): version_tuple = StrictVersion(version).version major = '.'.join(map(str, version_tuple[0:2])) minor = version return (major, minor)

commit_message:
Add microversion allocation on devref

We have discussed how to allocate a microversion for each patch
on nova-api meeting and this patch adds the conclusion on the rst.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions

Change-Id: I1f23294475d60b219d4167cad1650fd768f868a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/159715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Allocating a microversion ------------------------- If you are adding a patch which adds a new microversion, it is necessary to allocate next microversion of the latest ``_MAX_API_VERSION``. It is possible that multiple microversion patches would be proposed in parallel and the microversions would conflict between patches. We don't reserve a microversion for each patch in advance, and developers need to rebase a patch on the master if merging the other patch before. Each patch needs to change ``_MAX_API_VERSION`` as the above mentioned, and developers can know a microversion conflict and should update their own patches for using next microversion.

commit_message:
Add 2.0.0 plugins support

* install action now can install both .fp plugins and .rpm

* remove action can remove .fp and .rpm plugins

* update and downgrade actions are available for new plugin
  formats only

* register action was added for the users who install plugin
  directly with yum/rpm

* unregister action was added for the users who remove plugin
  directly with yum/rpm

* sync action is required for those users who use yum to perform
  massive update which includes a lot of plugins

* all unit tests were rewritten, now each layer
  (cli, objects, utils) is tested separately.

Change-Id: I2bc837fdaf356a4f4c7291cd0dbfc0a92dc433d6
Implements: blueprint plugins-security-fixes-delivery

gabbi: add "" around some strings

This is just because the YAML Emacs parser sucks and is confused about
those strings with a ' in them.

subject: Definition of _default _member_ role is necessary
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-17 09:57:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/699c06fc918d6a281f0e41952425752d95fab4f6', 'message': 'Definition of _default _member_ role is necessary

commit_message:
Definition of _default _member_ role is necessary

The role _member_ was previously implicitly created passing the
parameter --project when a user was created in Keystone. This behaviour
was changed in the commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150667/ so
the role _member_ is not anymore created in Devstack, but without its
existence it is impossible to create or edit projects in Horizon.
This patch restore --project as a parameter of get_or_create_user,
optional this time, and pass it to the function only when the user demo
is created, so the default _member_ role will be added in keystone.

Change-Id: I5f822b827e25a645bbb41986cef35939812a6908
Closes-Bug: 1421616

commit_message:
Graph and manifests cleanup for modularization

* Move needed resources from controller.pp to openstack-controller
* Rename 'top-role-controller' task to 'controller_end'
* Simplify tasks graph
* Add missing notice('MODULAR') function calls
* Remove unneeded ./openstack/manifests/controller_ha.pp file
* Move tweaks::ubuntu_service_override into proper manifests

Change-Id: I990aeb202ec34cc1289d36cd85c7894070d149b9
Related-Blueprint: fuel-library-modularization

commit_message:
Fix interface bringup command

This bug changes service networking restart command to
ifup <interface> since service networking restart does
not work anymore on Ubuntu 14.04.

Also fixes a broken URL.

Change-Id: Ibad47f8ed02466267c2e980c0cb7c57cdbd526f5
Closes-Bug: #1380155

commit_message:
Add user-param example to create-stack sample json.

The sample json for create-stack does not include an example of
how a user can pass in parameter values that are allowed by a template.
Updated create-stack example to include an example of how to do this for
clarity.

Change-Id: I6dbebd2de558f24fa04ffd777ea201d6eb7d027c
Closes-Bug: 1417807

commit_message:
Remove OS-EXT-IPS attributes from V2.1 server ips

V2.1 server ips response contain 'OS-EXT-IPS:type' & 'OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr'
also which are new attributes compared to V2 response.

These new attributes are found during tempest testing by blocking
additional properties in schema -https://review.openstack.org/#/c/156130/

V2.1 must be identical with V2 and must not contain any new attributes in
response. This commit removes these new attributes from V2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Id9fcce0c9629c3d325b87cf9b35f13f1ba15b13f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/159708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

is false.

commit_message:
Fix response schema for compute aggregate API

The response of "create aggregate" API is different from the other
aggregate APIs. For catching this difference, the schema needs to
be arranged but the way was wrong. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I98c9037855e0beb124bb72a71f2540877284bb24

deleted_lines: 'aggregate': aggregate# create-aggregate api doesn't have 'hosts' and 'metadata' attributes. del common_create_aggregate['response_body']['properties']['aggregate'][ 'properties']['hosts'] del common_create_aggregate['response_body']['properties']['aggregate'][ 'properties']['metadata'] common_create_aggregate['response_body']['properties']['aggregate'][ 'required'] = ['availability_zone', 'created_at', 'deleted', 'deleted_at', 'id', 'name', 'updated_at']

commit_message:
Remove 'locked_by' from V2.1 extended server status

In case of v2.1, extended server status contain 'locked_by' which does
not match with V2 response.

These new attributes are found during tempest testing by blocking
additional properties in schema -https://review.openstack.org/#/c/156130/

V2.1 must be identical with V2 and must not contain any new attributes in
response. This commit removes this extra attributes from V2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I5c4f6851300510f8fc5342d3bfc596e0ac9f1800

commit_message:
delete_on_termination param appears twice

In the serverCreateParameters ENTITY the
delete_on_termination param appears twice.
This makes it appears twice in the param
list for the POST /v2/{tenant_id}/servers
endpoint.

Change-Id: I46eb71f4162b39870dc7b3b998ba1b33aa3e661a

commit_message:
Fix Neutron LBaaS version path

The version path must match the Neutron
version, not the LBaaS extension version.

commit_message:
Remove 'id' from V2.1 update quota_set resp

In case of v2.1, update quota_set response contain 'id' which does
not match with V2 response.

These new attributes are found during tempest testing by blocking
additional properties in schema -
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Removal_new_attribute_V2_1

V2.1 must be identical with V2 and must not contain any new attributes in
response. This commit removes this extra attributes from V2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I7d1d03fadd1eaf90d9e37eb4f1dc330770f9ace9

commit_message:
Update stack-create request and response params.

The docs for stack-create were missing params for requests and
have the incorrect params for response.  Request params were listed
under 'response'.  Have moved params to 'request' section and have
made 'response' requests match reality.

Change-Id: If98ecd69c468d8545de0f9cca5ab701383b651df
Closes-Bug: 1417806

commit_message:
Remove copypasted export_location field from snapshots

Field export_location in snapshots db table and models
is leftover from Cinder, which should be removed.

- Remove export_location field from share_snapshots table
in manila_init migration
- Create db migration which removes export_location field
from share_snapshots in db
- Remove usages of export_location in snapshots related code
- Update functional and unit tests

Change-Id: I7566e74479cd7474d5576edae0e21b6eca18c394

commit_message:
ceph: don't rely on a particular agg. method

Currently, we rely of a random aggregation method to known
if the metric exists or not, but the supported aggregation methods
will change in the future, so removes this unwanted links.

Change-Id: Ifbb489bef14073344f52db4c4155f3adef223681

commit_message:
Add UUIDs to all tempest tests and gate check

Adds uuid4 as a decorator of the form:
@test.idempotent_id('12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789abc')
to every test in the Tempest tree. Includes a gate check to
ensure the existence and uniqueness of the ids.

Modify check tool to ignore Tempest unit tests.

Change-Id: I19e3c7dd555a3ea09d585fb9091c357a300e6559
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Slipushenko <sslypushenko@mirantis.com>
Implements: bp test-uuid

commit_message:
Add UUIDs to tests with tools and checks

This patch adds a new tool to check for existence and uniqueness
of UUIDs across Tempest or any other test repository based on
Tempest. The tool also includes an option to automatically tag
a test repository with UUIDs if they don't exist. The tool
will be used in the gate to ensure UUID existence.

Change-Id: I25aa83c7836f5a607af2aaa4bf862fa72766f799
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Slipushenko <sslypushenko@mirantis.com>
Partially-Implements: bp test-uuid
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/73/157273/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# Copyright 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ast from argparse import ArgumentParser from collections import OrderedDict from os import walk import uuid import traceback import re DECORATOR_MODULE = 'test' DECORATOR_NAME = 'meta' DECORATOR_IMPORT = 'tempest.%s' % DECORATOR_MODULE DECORATOR_TEMPLATE = "@%s.%s(uuid='%%s')" % (DECORATOR_MODULE, DECORATOR_NAME) IMPORT_LINE = 'from tempest import %s' % DECORATOR_MODULE def walk_py(tests_dir): py_files = [] for root, dirs, files in walk(tests_dir): for item in files: if item.endswith('.py'): py_files.append(root + '/' + item) return py_files def check_import_for_test_uuid(src_parsed): for node in [node for node in src_parsed.body if type(node) is ast.ImportFrom]: for name in node.names: if '%s.%s' % (node.module, name.name) == DECORATOR_IMPORT: return True def insert_node(src_lines, prev_node, next_node, node_lines): lineno = prev_node.lineno while lineno < len(src_lines): if lineno == next_node.lineno: lineno -= 1 break if src_lines[lineno - 1].strip(): lineno += 1 else: lineno -= 1 break return src_lines[:lineno] + node_lines + src_lines[lineno:] def find_uuid(node): if node.decorator_list and hasattr(node.decorator_list[0], 'func'): for decorator in node.decorator_list: if (decorator.func.attr == DECORATOR_NAME and decorator.func.value.id == DECORATOR_MODULE): return decorator.keywords[0].value.s def extract_tests(src): src_parsed = ast.parse(src) src_lines = src.split('
') tests = {} for node in src_parsed.body: if node.__class__ is ast.ClassDef: for subnode in node.body: if (subnode.__class__ is ast.FunctionDef and subnode.name.startswith('test_')): test_def = re.compile(r'^\s*def ' + subnode.name) deflineno = subnode.lineno while (src_lines[deflineno-1] and not test_def.match(src_lines[deflineno-1])): deflineno += 1 tests[deflineno] = { 'name': '%s.%s' % (node.name, subnode.name), 'uuid': find_uuid(subnode), 'col_offset': subnode.col_offset, 'lineno': subnode.lineno, 'deflineno': deflineno } return OrderedDict([(lineno, tests[lineno]) for lineno in sorted(tests.keys())]) def update_src(src): tests = extract_tests(src) if not tests: return src src_with_uuid = insert_import_for_test_uuid(src) tests = extract_tests(src_with_uuid) return insert_test_uuids(src_with_uuid, update_tests(tests)) def find_function_def_line(src_lines, lineno, function_name): """The python ast gives a logical line number for the beginning of a function definition rather than a physical line number for the 'def' string itself. This method finds the line number for the definition. Useful for placing UUIDs directly before the definition. lineno counting starts at 1 """ deflineno = lineno test_def = re.compile(r'^\s*def ' + function_name) while (src_lines[deflineno-1] and not test_def.match(src_lines[deflineno-1])): deflineno += 1 return deflineno def parse_tests(src): """Parses the tests and attempts to extract UUID information, if it is available. Returns a dictionary of line numbers that match the location of the test definition along with metadata including the parsed line number and UUID information if it exists""" parsed = ast.parse(src) src_lines = src.split('
') tests = {} for node in parsed.body: if node.__class__ is ast.ClassDef: for subnode in node.body: if (subnode.__class__ is ast.FunctionDef and subnode.name.startswith('test_')): deflineno = find_function_def_line(src_lines, subnode.lineno, subnode.name) tests[deflineno] = { 'name': '%s.%s' % (node.name, subnode.name), 'uuid': find_uuid(subnode), 'col_offset': subnode.col_offset, 'lineno': subnode.lineno, 'deflineno': deflineno } return OrderedDict([(lineno, tests[lineno]) for lineno in sorted(tests.keys())]) def check_uniqueness(uuid_dictionary, parsed_test): """Given a set parsed tests, check uniqueness against known dictionary of tests with uuids. Returns the colliding test and parsed test as a tuple if it is not unique. If it is unique it mutates the uuid_dictionary with the parsed test. Tests without a uuid will be skipped.""" if parsed_test['uuid']: if parsed_test['uuid'] in uuid_dictionary: return (uuid_dictionary[parsed_test.uuid], parsed_test) else: uuid_dictionary[parsed_test['uuid']] = parsed_test def find_collisions(uuid_dictionary, test_list): """Look for collisions against a uuid dictinary, while adding new uuids to the dictionary that don't collide.""" collisions = [] if test_list: for lineno in test_list: parsed_test = test_list[lineno] collision = check_uniqueness(uuid_dictionary, parsed_test) if collision: collisions.append(collision) return collisions def find_untagged(test_list): """Look for tests that don't have a uuid in a parsed test list""" untagged = [] for lineno in test_list: parsed_test = test_list[lineno] if not parsed_test['uuid']: untagged.append(parsed_test) return untagged def report_collisions(filename, collisions): """Reports collisions if there are any. Returns true if collisions exist.""" result = False for first, second in collisions: error = "%s line %s function %s uuid %s collision with %s" % ( filename, first.lineno, first.name, first.uuid, second.name ) print error result = True return result def report_untagged(filename, untagged_list): """Reports untagged tests if there are any. Returns true if untagged tests exist.""" result = False for untagged in untagged_list: error = "%s line %s function %s missing uuid" % ( filename, untagged['lineno'], untagged['name']) print error result = True True def insert_uuid(src, untagged): """Returns a new source file with automatically inserted uuids based on the list of untagged functions.""" testlist = list(untagged) current_test = testlist.pop(0) current_lineno = current_test['deflineno'] new_src_lines = [] lineno = 1 src_lines = src.split('
') while src_lines: line = src_lines.pop(0) lineno += 1 if current_lineno == lineno - 1: new_uuid_line = '%s%s' % ( ' ' * current_test['col_offset'], DECORATOR_TEMPLATE % str(uuid.uuid4())) new_src_lines.append(new_uuid_line) if testlist: current_test = testlist.pop(0) current_lineno = current_test['deflineno'] else: current_lineno = None new_src_lines.append(line) return '
'.join(new_src_lines) def insert_import(src): """Returns a new source file with a tempest.test import added if it does not already exist.""" src_parsed = ast.parse(src) node_index = None new_import_group = True last_import_in_group = True node_index = 0 for node in [node for node in src_parsed.body if type(node) in (ast.ImportFrom, ast.Import)]: node_index = src_parsed.body.index(node) if type(node) is ast.Import: continue if 'tempest' not in node.module: continue new_import_group = False if check_import_for_test_uuid(src_parsed): return src if '%s.%s' % (node.module, node.names[0].name) < DECORATOR_IMPORT: continue else: last_import_in_group = False node_index -= 1 break src_lines = src.split('
') import_lines = [] if new_import_group: import_lines += [''] import_lines += [IMPORT_LINE] if last_import_in_group and \ src_lines[src_parsed.body[node_index + 1].lineno - 2].strip(): import_lines += [''] new_src_lines = insert_node( src_lines, src_parsed.body[node_index], src_parsed.body[node_index + 1], import_lines ) return '
'.join(new_src_lines) def fix_tests(src, untagged): """Given target file source and a set of untagged tests, attempts to fix tempest import and UUID tagging errors by automatically generating UUID metadata for untagged tests.""" src_with_uuid = insert_uuid(src, untagged) src_with_import = insert_import(src_with_uuid) return src_with_import if __name__ == '__main__': parser = ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument('-d', action='store', dest='tests_dir', default='.', type=str, help='Path to the directory with tests.') parser.add_argument('--fix', action='store_true', dest='fix_tests', help='Attempt to fix tests without UUIDs') parser.add_argument('--skip_errors', action='store_true', dest='skip_errors', help='Ignore thrown exceptions') args = parser.parse_args() uuid_dictionary = {} error = False for py_file in walk_py(args.tests_dir): try: file_error = False with open(py_file, 'r') as f: src_py = f.read() test_list = parse_tests(src_py) collisions = find_collisions(uuid_dictionary, test_list) untagged = find_untagged(test_list) file_error = report_collisions(py_file, collisions) and file_error file_error = report_untagged(py_file, untagged) and file_error if args.fix_tests and untagged: fixed_src = fix_tests(src_py, untagged) with open(py_file, 'w') as f: f.write(fixed_src) print 'Updated %s' % py_file error = error and file_error except Exception: print "%s failed parsing or fixing" % py_file if args.skip_errors: traceback.print_exc() else: raise

Fix devstack running behind a proxy

As suggested by dtroyer to resolve wheels not buildings
behind a proxy. Issue introduced in I0283b0dff9146b1b63bd821358505a93566270c6

commit_message:
Make listing security groups faster

If we have a large number of security groups (more than 1000) with
security group rules (about 100 for each group) listing them
could take rather long time(more than 1 minute).

Adding lazy join to backref to SecurityGroupRule model will make
it faster at list on 15%.

Change-Id: I648a48cdefe0faf75c0c62bd8adffc12547293be
Closes-bug: #1426383
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/50/159850/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
carbonara: percentile must be a float

On numpy < 1.9, percentile method doesn't magically
convert the q argument into float, so do it manually.

Change-Id: I5b98b0471d2769e985a098cf508a8b97d2bcb0bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/13/160413/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.aggregation_method_func = functools.partial( self._percentile, q=float(m.group(1)))

commit_message:
Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher

Because of eventlet bug "eventlet.green override of os.waitpid
returns immediately in all cases"(
https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/92/eventletgreen-override-of-oswaitpid)
in scope of fixing openstack bug "Excessive CPU usage in ProcessLauncher()'s wait loop"
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+bug/109534) additional sleep was added.
Since this bug is resolved and openstack depends on eventlet >=0.16
excessive sleep was removed.

Change-Id: Ief30758ff429b4adc2265a8ed7ae34c5b8c60a34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/45/156345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Block while any of child processes have exited pid, status = os.waitpid(0, 0)
deleted_lines: # Don't block if no child processes have exited pid, status = os.waitpid(0, os.WNOHANG)

Creating multiple instances of a provider leads to unpredictable
results. Instances of dependencies may hold references to any of the
instances.

The provider instance for the extensions (federation and oauth1) were
created multiple times when keystone-all was run because there's one
instance created per pipeline (once for the admin and once for public).
The dependency module is enhanced to provide a function to create the
instance of a provider only if it hasn't been created already and the
extensions changed to use it rather than create the manager directly.

The dependency module raises an exception if another instance of a
provider is created. The exception has the backtrace where the first
instance was created.

Change-Id: Idaba61a3cfb851ec7e0e9f7b991f675d77af14e0
"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2014-10-03 00:48:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/888f38b064d6368b484430a1b6142a2df4c1947a', 'message': "Avoid multiple instances for a provider

created multiple times when keystone-all was run because there's one
instance created per pipeline (once for the admin and once for public).
The dependency module is enhanced to provide a function to create the
instance of a provider only if it hasn't been created already and the
extensions changed to use it rather than create the manager directly.

The dependency module raises an exception if another instance of a
provider is created. The exception has the backtrace where the first
instance was created.

Change-Id: Idaba61a3cfb851ec7e0e9f7b991f675d77af14e0

commit_message:
Avoid multiple instances for a provider

Creating multiple instances of a provider leads to unpredictable
results. Instances of dependencies may hold references to any of the
instances.

The dependency module raises an exception if another instance of a
provider is created. The exception has the backtrace where the first
instance was created.

Closes-Bug: #1408384
Change-Id: Idaba61a3cfb851ec7e0e9f7b991f675d77af14e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/99/124599/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if name in REGISTRY: raise Exception("%s was already registered." % name) if dependency in REGISTRY: raise Exception("%s was already registered." % dependency) if dependency in REGISTRY: raise Exception( "%s was already registered." % dependency)

commit_message:
Remove python-novaclient from requirements.txt

Change I050e92bc5620d6e748cf1d948ef2a52305aa02b5 removed the novaclient
cli tests from tempest, which was the last use of python-novaclient in
tempest. However, it neglected to remove it from the requirements.txt
file. This commit fixes the oversight.

Change-Id: Ib2d321846a79fe7582ea4dc7f80e146963b37d16

commit_message:
Remove non-ASCII characters from puppet doc

It crashes catalog compilation with this error:
  Error 400 on SERVER: invalid byte sequence in US-ASCII

Change-Id: Ia784c840b1b05ed43b3f72426caa480916d9635b
Closes-bug: #1420979
(cherry picked from commit 60e785776b89bdfd4cd09c4260d0908c4fdf2d4b)

commit_message:
Add manage_service feature

puppet-swift lacks of disabling service managing. This patch adds
$manage_service and $enabled parameter to all relevant classes.

Closes-bug: #1359823
Change-Id: I3d632e3a26e9394d03d94089ae704904bf77aa51
(cherry picked from commit 22f09aed4f3c93a0d06ed1884b90dcaede60a6f7)

commit_message:
Fix spec tests in stable/juno branch

The change 152595 and 159261 must be merged together because their are
inter-dependent

This patch set the `concat_basedir` default for spec tests and pin
rspec-puppet to 1.0.1 because the new version broke puppet-openstack
unit tests (undefined method `resource')

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <lbezdick@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4b686e5ebe3d3641b95669071a7b4dd678f19d11

commit_message:
Remove attach/detach/swap from V2.1 extended_volumes

V2.1 must be identical with V2 and must not contain any new attributes
and new method. And those methods have same methods in the volumes
extensions. Those methods are added in the early stage of v3 works,
because the in early stage v3 works decides to delete any volume related
proxy API, then adds those method instead of them. This commit remove
these methods from V2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I20e0498ec187e9feafd2bfb1aa9646426b3609af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/160150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove unused ironic handler

Ironic Bay is built by bay_k8s_heat handler using kubecluster-fedora-ironic
template. So bay_ironic handler is unnecessary. This remove it.

Partially implements blueprint ironic-heat-template

Change-Id: I0557ecb9fbb24cb2babcaaa130cf1e18cbcf99d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/49/160249/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """Magnum Bay Ironic RPC handler.""" from magnum import objects from magnum.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) # These are the backend operations. They are executed by the backend # service. API calls via AMQP (within the ReST API) trigger the handlers to # be called. class Handler(object): def __init__(self): super(Handler, self).__init__() # Bay Operations def bay_create(self, context, bay): LOG.debug('ironic bay_create') bay.create() return bay def bay_delete(self, context, uuid): LOG.debug('ironic bay_delete') bay = objects.Bay.get_by_uuid(context, uuid) bay.destroy() return None def bay_show(self, context, uuid): LOG.debug('ironic bay_show') bay = objects.Bay.get_by_uuid(context, uuid) return bay

commit_message:
Optionally install tempest and disable by default

In I78d51f04ed01da4ce8aa0e127be028f969d3b4f8 we turned off installing
tempest because we install it on stable branches where the stable reqs
do not equal the tempest master (branchless) reqs.

Leave this off by default since that is the behaviour we have in the
gate, and make default devstack as similar to the gate as possible. But
add an option to install tempest by default so developers can opt and
reproduce the previous behaviour.

Update the tempest section of the README with how to run tempest tests
and how to install tempest if desired.

Change-Id: Ie4ea7335a57917244873ec54658ca269ab765ce1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/89/154689/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: INSTALL_TEMPEST=${INSTALL_TEMPEST:-True} if [[ "$INSTALL_TEMPEST" == "True" ]]; then Q_RR_COMMAND="sudo" setup_develop $TEMPEST_DIR elsefi

commit_message:
Add back IP addresses to PUBLIC_INTERFACE when unstacking

Change-Id: Ic9189c9ba126317425fda9161b19f544f32cb413
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/26/159526/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for IP in $(ip addr show dev $OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE | grep ' inet ' | awk '{print $2}'); do sudo ip addr del $IP dev $OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE sudo ip addr add $IP dev $PUBLIC_INTERFACE done sudo route del -net $FIXED_RANGE gw $NETWORK_GATEWAY dev $OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE
deleted_lines: if is_provider_network && is_ironic_hardware; then for IP in $(ip addr show dev $OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE | grep ' inet ' | awk '{print $2}'); do sudo ip addr del $IP dev $OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE sudo ip addr add $IP dev $PUBLIC_INTERFACE done sudo route del -net $FIXED_RANGE gw $NETWORK_GATEWAY dev $OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE fi
